hero.headline: Is Your Resume An Actual Disaster Waiting to Happen?
hero.subheadline: Ready to play “Resume Roulette” with recruiters? Neither are we. Perfect Resume Scan is your free, brutally honest AI resume checker that runs 16 relentless checks—because sending out garbage is so 2022.
hero.cta: Drop your resume here or pick a file.

hero.privacy_description: We’re not interested in your personal info, your social media, or what you had for breakfast. Your resume gets deleted ASAP, and so do our memories of it.

how_it_works.headline: How Does It Work? Glad You Asked (You Secretly Had No Idea)

steps.step: Step 1: Survive the ATS—Or Don’t Get Seen
steps.description: Fact: If your resume isn’t ATS-friendly, you may as well spend your job search watering your neighbor’s plants for fun. We check what companies’ Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) crave: right file, right format, and, yes—keywords that don’t sound like desperate clickbait.

scoring_system.headline: Our Ruthless Two-Part Scoring

parts.title: How Much Can Our AI Actually Understand Your Resume?
parts.description: If our AI gets confused, so does every robot recruiter out there.

parts.title: What Did You Actually Write?
parts.description: Typos, clichés, impressive-sounding nonsense—sit tight, our checker’s not shy with feedback.

scoring_system.ai_description: We’ve chained up ChatGPT-4 behind the scenes, so every resume check is powered by the world’s most sophisticated AI—and the patience of a saint forced to read 1000 resumes a day.

checklist.headline: The Checklist: We’re Judge, Jury, and (Resume) Executioner
items: Content (Does your experience actually say something?)
ATS Parse Rate (Do robots like you?)
Repetition (Did you use “innovative” more than once? Oops.)
Spelling & Grammar (Let’s keep your 8th grade English teacher happy)
Impact Quantification (Did you “do stuff” or did you “increase revenue by 42%”?)
File Format & Size (Is your file actually readable, or is it just wishful thinking?)
Bullet Points (Longer than your job? We'll help you cut them down)
Skills Suggestions (Yes, “team player” still isn’t a real skill)
Hard & Soft Skills (Mix appropriately, like cocktails)
Contact Info (Do you want recruiters to contact you or your spam folder?)
Essential Sections (If you forgot Education, start over.)
Style & Design (Comic Sans fans, step aside.)
Email Address (Still using hotmail? We’re judging.)
